intro: Kairoa villosa, commonly known as the hairy kairoa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage is often covered in fine, soft hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Kairoa villosa is an important component of New Zealand's native flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its natural habitats.
